benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/admin/invoices - Trigger an invoice generation for all parked accounts

covered: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios cover successful generation under default, offset/limit, optional headers, no parked accounts, maximum limit edge case, partial input, and regression tests for header parsing and backward compatibility.
Error Handling: Tests for missing required header (TC05), invalid parameter values (TC06, TC07), unauthorized access (TC08), and service unavailability (TC09) are present.

Edge Cases: Tests for extra unexpected query parameters (TC11), extremely large data volume (TC12), partial input (TC13), security header injection (TC14), and concurrent/performance considerations (TC18, TC19) present.
Recovery/Resilience: Transient failure recovery (TC15) addresses retry behavior.
gaps: Pagination: While offset/limit scenarios exist (TC02, TC13), explicit tests for general pagination boundaries (e.g., offset beyond total, end-of-list behavior) are missing.
Authorisation/Access: Although TC08 covers unauthorized access, there is no separate, isolated test focusing strictly on the authorization boundary (e.g., 401 vs 403 distinction under varying roles).
Rate Limiting: No tests for rate limiting or throttling under bursty concurrent requests.
Caching Behavior: No tests validating caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or caching semantics.
Invalid Payload Scenarios: No test explicitly validating malformed or invalid payload fields in the body (e.g., wrong data types, missing required fields in the payload body).
Duplicate Submission: No test ensuring idempotency or handling of duplicate submissions.
Server Error Handling: Scenarios simulate service unavailability but there is no explicit test for internal server errors (e.g., database failure returning 500).
Performance under concurrency: TC18 discusses concurrency but lacks explicit assertions on idempotency guarantees per parked account under high contention.
recommendations: Add explicit pagination boundary tests (e.g., offset beyond end, end-of-list behavior) to solidify large dataset handling.
Introduce dedicated authorization boundary test focusing on 401 vs 403 distinctions across roles or token states.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests to verify behavior under bursty concurrent requests.
Add caching tests to verify presence and behavior of caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control).
Add invalid payload tests validating body schema: missing required fields, wrong data types, and malformed JSON payloads.
Add duplicate submission tests to ensure idempotency or proper deduplication handling.
Add explicit internal server error (500) scenarios to ensure proper server-side error propagation and messaging.
Expand performance tests with clearer quantitative SLAs for concurrency and ensure idempotent invoice generation per parked account under load.
